reference.title: euca-bundle-vol
reference.shortdesc: Bundles an image for use with Eucalyptus or Amazon EC2, compressing, encrypting and signing a snapshot of the local machine's root file system.

section.title: Syntax
section.codeblock: euca-bundle-vol [-p PREFIX] [-d DIR] [-r {i386,x86_64,armhf,ppc,ppc64}] [-e PATH,...] [-i PATH,...] [-s MiB] [--no-filter] [--all] [--inherit | --no-inherit] [-v DIR] [-P {mbr,gpt,none}] [-S FILE] [--fstab FILE | --generate-fstab] [--grub-config FILE] [-k FILE] [-c FILE] [--ec2cert FILE] [-u ACCOUNT] [--kernel IMAGE] [--ramdisk IMAGE] [-B VIRTUAL1=DEVICE1,VIRTUAL2=DEVICE2,...] [--productcodes CODE1,CODE2,...] [--progress | --no-progress] [--debug] [--debugger] [--version] [-h]

row.entry: File name prefix for the bundle files. Default is "image".
Path to user's PEM-encoded private key.
12-digit account ID of the person who is bundling the image.
Explicitly inherit instance metadata and add it to the bundled image (this is the default behavior).
Do not inherit instance metadata and add it to the bundled image.

Which partition standard you want to use: Master Boot Record, GUID Partition Table, or no partition
Valid values: mbr | gpt | none
Do not use the default filtered files list.
Path to the fstab to bundle in the image.
Generate fstab to bundle in the image.
File containing the cloud's X.509 certificate.
ID of the kernel image to associate with the machine bundle.
ID of the ramdisk image to associate with the machine bundle.
Show a progress bar during command execution. This is the default when this command is run interactively.
Do not show a progress bar during command execution. This is the default when this command is run non-interactively.
Region to direct requests to. Only valid for EC2 endpoints. Meaning what?
URL of the cloud to connect to. Expects an EC2 endpoint /services/Eucalyptus. What does this sentence mean?

Read credentials and cloud settings from the specified config file.
Default: $HOME/.eucarc or /etc/euca2ools/eucarc.
Prints what the command sends to the server and what it receives from the server. Use when you're trying to debug Euca2ools.
Display the manual page for the command.
Display the version of this tool

section.title: Output
section.p: Eucalyptus returns status messages describing the stages and status of the bundling.
